title: Lesson 14
paragraph: Work and business include jobs, careers and workplaces where employees and employers cooperate to reach goals. Contracts, meetings and training help staff develop skills, and tasks, deadlines and teamwork shape professional success.

words.meaning: to promote a product or service publicly
words.example: We will advertise the new product on TV.

words.meaning: a formal request or a software program
words.japaneseMeaning: 申請、応募、アプリケーション
words.example: Submit your application by Friday.

words.meaning: a scheduled meeting or time
words.example: I have a doctor's appointment at noon.

words.meaning: a person who helps someone in their job
words.example: Her assistant organised the files.

words.meaning: a person in charge at work
words.example: The boss approved my holiday request.

words.meaning: actively engaged in work or activity
words.example: I'm too busy to attend the meeting.

words.meaning: a person's chosen profession or lifetime work
words.example: She chose a career in medicine.

words.meaning: a business organization that sells goods or services
words.example: He works for a large company.

words.meaning: rivalry between businesses or individuals
words.japaneseMeaning: 競争、コンペティション
words.example: Competition keeps prices low.

words.meaning: a formal agreement between parties
words.example: Sign the contract before starting work.

words.meaning: a document summarising a person's education and work history
words.example: Update your CV before applying.

words.meaning: the latest time by which something must be done
words.example: Meet the deadline for the project.

words.meaning: a division within a company or organisation
words.example: She works in the sales department.

words.meaning: a responsibility or task someone must do
words.example: It's my duty to finish the report.

words.meaning: a person who works for someone
words.example: Employees receive training each year.

words.meaning: a person or organisation that hires people
words.example: The employer offered a permanent position.

words.meaning: having a paid job
words.example: Find employment after graduating.

words.meaning: knowledge or skill gained through doing something
words.example: Work experience helps your CV.

words.meaning: a building where goods are manufactured
words.example: The factory produced thousands of units.

words.meaning: working the standard number of hours for a job
words.example: She found full-time employment after college.

words.meaning: an objective or target to achieve
words.example: Set a clear goal for the project.

words.meaning: money received regularly for work or investments
words.example: Their income increased after the raise.

words.meaning: business activity concerned with production of goods
words.example: He works in the technology industry.

words.meaning: a formal meeting for job selection
words.example: Prepare answers for the interview.

words.meaning: paid work or position
words.example: She found a job in marketing.

words.meaning: a legal professional who advises or represents clients
words.example: Consult a lawyer about the contract.

words.meaning: a person responsible for controlling or administering a business
words.example: The manager organised the team meeting.

words.meaning: a gathering of people to discuss matters
words.example: We have a meeting at 10 a.m.

words.meaning: a room or building where business is done
words.example: She works in an office downtown.

words.meaning: a chance for progress or advancement
words.example: Apply for the opportunity to study abroad.

words.meaning: working beyond normal hours
words.example: They paid overtime for weekend work.

words.meaning: working fewer hours than full-time
words.example: She works part-time at the café.

words.meaning: a paid occupation, especially one requiring training
words.example: Teaching is a rewarding profession.

words.meaning: advancement to a higher position
words.example: He received a promotion to manager.

words.meaning: an official certification showing ability
words.example: Obtain the qualification before applying.

words.meaning: to hire new staff
words.example: They will recruit new trainees next month.

words.meaning: a duty or task someone is required to perform
words.example: It's my responsibility to complete the report.

words.meaning: to stop working after reaching a certain age
words.example: She will retire after thirty years at the firm.

words.meaning: regular payment for work, usually monthly
words.example: His salary increased with experience.

words.meaning: a person who handles administrative tasks
words.example: The secretary arranged the schedule.

words.meaning: work done for others or a business providing help
words.example: Customer service answered my question.

words.meaning: all the employees of an organisation
words.example: The staff work together to meet goals.

words.meaning: the achievement of a desired result
words.example: Hard work leads to success.

words.meaning: a piece of work assigned or to be done
words.example: Complete the task by Friday.

words.meaning: a group of people working together
words.example: The team achieved its quarterly targets.

words.meaning: learning activities to improve skills
words.example: Attend training to learn the new system.

words.meaning: without paid work but seeking a job
words.example: He has been unemployed for three months.

words.meaning: payment for work usually calculated hourly or weekly
words.example: The factory raised the minimum wage.

words.meaning: a person who performs work
words.example: Workers protested for better conditions.

words.meaning: the place where people do their jobs
words.example: A safe workplace is important for all employees.
